intro: Cuenotia, commonly known as the red spider lily, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking red, spider-like flowers. The plant has strap-shaped, grass-like leaves that are often mistaken for those of grasses or sedges. Cuenotia thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full shade. It is a perennial herb that blooms in late spring to early summer.
